case_vignette: A SEXUALLY ACTIVE 37-YEAR-OLD MAN COMES TO THE PHYSICIAN BECAUSE OF A 7-DAY HISTORY OF ITCHING IN THE AREA OF HIS GENITALS. HE ALSO REPORTS BURNING ON MICTURITION. HE HAS TYPE 2 DIABETES MELLITUS, WHICH IS WELL CONTROLLED WITH ORAL METFORMIN. PELVIC EXAMINATION SHOWS TENDER, ATROPHIC WHITE PAPULES ON THE GLANS AND PREPUCE, WITH ERYTHEMA OF THE SURROUNDING SKIN. THE URINARY MEATUS IS NARROWED AND SCLEROTIC.
question: WHICH OF THE FOLLOWING IS THE MOST APPROPRIATE NEXT STEP IN DIAGNOSIS?

trial_0.vignette_frq: Perform a biopsy of the lesions.

Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing itching in my genital area for about a week and it burns when I pee.
Have you noticed any discharge or change in color or odor of your urine?
No, I haven't noticed any discharge or changes in the color or odor of my urine.
Are you currently taking any medications or did you recently take antibiotics?
I am currently taking oral metformin for my type 2 diabetes.
Do you have any new sexual partners or have had unprotected sexual contact recently?
Yes, I am sexually active.
Have you had similar symptoms in the past?
No, I have not had similar symptoms in the past.
Final Diagnosis: Genital herpes.
